abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Technical Assistance for
            Revenue Enhancement and Fiscal Management for Lebanon were
            as follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: Greater
            beneficiary agency involvement is necessary from the outset.
            Difficult automation project require adequate project
            planning, especially in terms of properly identifying
            accompanying reforms, human resource requirements, capacity
            building requirements and other peripheral issues. There is
            a clear correlation between lack of capacity and length of
            implementation. No matter how simple the design and how well
            defined the activity, building capacity for institutional
            reforms may require a longer time frame than what is
            generally practiced. Donor-funded enclaves of technical
            excellence can and should be mainstreamed into the
            traditional civil service. To enlist champions within the
            administration, he project focused on achieving early wins
            in highly visible areas to signal others that the old
            processes no longer represent a venue for exercising power
            or maintain social status. There is a clear correlation
            between the capacity at entry and the closeness of
            supervision to be provided.
